name: 18 Del
scenarioDescription:
The 18 Del Exoplanetary System


Overview

18 Del is a star with 2.3 times the mass of the Sun, and 8.5 times its radius. It is located 249.12 light years away from the solar system.

18 Del is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the 18 Del system


18 Del b

18 Del b was discovered by the Okayama Astrophysical Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 2.60 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of 18 Del b is 3275.4 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, 18 Del b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system 18 Del, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Okayama Astrophysical Observatory.
